Package cosc201.a2

Interface WordBank

public interface WordBank
An interface for a word bank that stores words and their values. For this prototype implementation words must consist of Strings of lowercase letters a-z. The value of a word is a non-negative long integer. While the implementation will not be tested for efficiency, to obtain full marks all operations that manipulate or access the contents of the WordBank should execute in expected constant time per word involved. This might be input in the case of add or remove operations, or output in the case of get operations. You will submit an implementation of this interface -- that is, a class that implements the WordBank interface.

  • Method Details

    • getValue

      long getValue(String word)
      Returns the value associated with the word, or NOT_FOUND if the word is not in the bank.
      Parameters:
      word - A word whose value is to be determined
      Returns:
      The word's value or NOT_FOUND

    • addWord

      void addWord(String word, long value)
      Add a word to the bank with the given value. If the word is not valid, or the value is negative throw an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      word - A word to be added to the bank
      value - Its value

    • addWords

      void addWords(Collection<String> words, long value)
      Add a collection of words to the bank with the given value. Ignore any invalid words but if the value is negative throw an IllegalArgumentException.
      Parameters:
      words - A collection of words to be added to the bank
      value - Their common value

    • removeWord

      void removeWord(String word)
      Remove a word from the bank. If the word is invalid or not in the bank, do nothing.
      Parameters:
      word - A word to be removed from the bank

    • removeWords

      void removeWords(Collection<String> words)
      Remove a collection of words from the bank. Ignore any words that are not in the bank.
      Parameters:
      words - The collection of words to remove

    • getWords

      Set<String> getWords(long value)
      Return the words in the bank of the given value.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to be searched for.
      Returns:
      The words in the bank of that value.

    • getWords

      Set<String> getWords(long lowValue, long highValue)
      Return the words in the bank with values in the range lowValue inclusive to highValue exclusive.
      Parameters:
      lowValue - The lowest value (inclusive)
      highValue - The highest value (exclusive)
      Returns:
      The words in the bank with values in the range lowValue to highValue.

    • isValidWord

      static boolean isValidWord(String word)
      Return true if the word consists entirely of letters in the range a-z. Note this is provided - you do not need to implement it.
      Parameters:
      word - A word to be tested
      Returns:
      true if the word is formed from a-z, false otherwise.

    • getMaximumWord

      String getMaximumWord(Collection<String> words)
      Return the word in the bank from the given collection with the maximum value. If there are multiple words with the same value, any one of them could be returned. Words not in the bank are to be ignored, and if no words from the collection belong to the bank then the method should return null.
      Parameters:
      words - A collection of words.
      Returns:
      A word of maximum value among the words in the collection.

    • getMinimumWord

      String getMinimumWord(Collection<String> words)
      Return the word in the bank from the given collection with the minimum value. If there are multiple words with the same value, any one of them could be returned. Words not in the bank, or invalid words, are to be ignored, and if no words from the collection belong to the bank then the method should return null.
      Parameters:
      words - A collection of words.
      Returns:
      A word of minimum value among the words in the collection

    • getMedianWord

      String getMedianWord(Collection<String> words)
      Return the word in the bank from the given collection with the median value. If there are multiple words with the same value, any one of them could be returned. Words not in the bank or invalid words are to be ignored, and if no words from the collection belong to the bank then the method should return null. In the case where the number of words in the collection that are in the bank is even, and the median value is not well-defined (e.g., the values are 1, 2, 3, 4), the method should return a word with the higher value of the two that could be considered the median.
      Parameters:
      words - A collection of words.
      Returns:
      A word of median value among the words in the collection

    • getMeanWord

      String getMeanWord(Collection<String> words)
      Return the word in the bank from the given collection with the mean value. If there are multiple words with the same value, any one of them could be returned. Words not in the bank or invalid words are to be ignored, and if no words from the collection belong to the bank then the method should return null. In the case where the mean value is not an integer, or there are no words with the mean value in the list then one from the list whose value is as close as possible to the mean should be returned.
      Parameters:
      words - A collection of words
      Returns:
      A word of nearest to mean value among the words in the collection

    • getDocumentValue

      long getDocumentValue(Collection<String> words)
      Return the value of a document, considered as a collection of words. The value of a document is the sum of the values of all the distinct words it contains, meaning that invalid words or words not in the bank are ignored, as are the second and subsequent occurrences of a word.
      Parameters:
      words - A collection of words
      Returns:
      The value of the document
